perturbation.original_text: EFS shall prominently display, as is customary in the industry, and implement a terms of use policy ("TOU")  on the Websites, which shall comply with all applicable Laws and which at a minimum prohibits orders from any customer under  eighteen (18) years of age (or the applicable age of majority in the jurisdiction in which the customer resides) and explains EFS'  purchasing and return policies. EFS shall implement a privacy policy ("Privacy Policy") applicable to users of the Websites and  the Catalogs that is no less protective of user privacy than is required under the Laws of or otherwise applicable to the Territory.  Such Privacy Policy shall be prominently displayed, as is customary in the industry, within the Websites and the Catalogs and be  easily accessible to users. EFS shall not take any action, and shall not operate the Websites or the Catalogs, in contravention of  such Privacy Policy or of any applicable Law, including, but not limited to, data protection provisions imposed by the United  Sates, the European Union or the other countries of the Territory and other applicable Laws.
perturbation.changed_text: EFS shall prominently display, as is customary in the industry, and implement a terms of use policy ("TOU")  on the Websites, and explains EFS' purchasing and return policies. EFS shall implement a privacy policy ("Privacy Policy") applicable to users of the Websites and  the Catalogs. Such Privacy Policy shall be prominently displayed, as is customary in the industry, within the Websites and the Catalogs and be  easily accessible to users. EFS shall not take any action, and shall not operate the Websites or the Catalogs, in contravention of  such Privacy Policy.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the mandatory age restriction for customers violates COPPA (Children's Online Privacy Protection Act) if the website is accessible to children under 13. This introduces a legal risk because it potentially allows the collection of data from minors without parental consent, which is a direct violation of federal law. Additionally, deleting the phrase 'that is no less protective of user privacy than is required under the Laws of or otherwise applicable to the Territory' from the requirement for the Privacy Policy removes the legal mandate to protect user privacy, therefore making it a legal contradiction.
perturbation.contradicted_law: COPPA (Children's Online Privacy Protection Act) and various state privacy laws

perturbation.original_text: EFS shall be solely responsible for and shall ensure the security of all customer  data collected in connection with the Playboy Commerce Business, including, but not limited to, personally identifiable information  and transaction information (collectively, the "User Data"). Client and EFS shall jointly own and have rights to all User Data  collected hereunder provided, however, that EFS shall only use the User Data in strict accordance with the Privacy Policy and,  subject to the remainder of this Section 5, solely in connection with the Playboy Commerce Business. EFS shall gather, retain in its  records, and take all necessary measures (which may include disclosure in the Privacy Policy and/or an opt-in mechanism) in  order to provide such User Data to Client, as well as information on usage and viewing of the Websites and such additional  information as Client may reasonably request. EFS warrants that it has implemented and will maintain during the Term of this  Agreement an information security program that is reasonably designed to: (a) ensure the security, integrity and confidentiality of  User Data collected hereunder; (b) protect against anticipated threats or hazards to the security or integrity of User Data; and (c)  protect against unauthorized access to or use of User Data. EFS agrees that included in EFS' information security program are  policies and administrative and technical measures specifically prohibiting and preventing the placement of User Data in or on any  form of mobile media (e.g., CD's or flash drives and other external storage media). EFS shall notify Client immediately in the  event EFS believes that User Data collected hereunder has been or potentially could have been accessed by an unauthorized  individual and shall cooperate with Client and indemnify Client regarding any investigation or response to a security breach,  including any claims, notifications or protection of Client's employees related therewith.
perturbation.changed_text: EFS shall be solely responsible for and shall ensure the security of all customer  data collected in connection with the Playboy Commerce Business, including, but not limited to, personally identifiable information  and transaction information (collectively, the "User Data"). Client and EFS shall jointly own and have rights to all User Data  collected hereunder provided, however, that EFS shall only use the User Data solely in connection with the Playboy Commerce Business. EFS shall gather, retain in its  records, and take all necessary measures in  order to provide such User Data to Client, as well as information on usage and viewing of the Websites and such additional  information as Client may reasonably request. EFS agrees that included in EFS' information security program are  policies and administrative and technical measures specifically prohibiting and preventing the placement of User Data in or on any  form of mobile media (e.g., CD's or flash drives and other external storage media). EFS shall notify Client immediately in the  event EFS believes that User Data collected hereunder has been or potentially could have been accessed by an unauthorized  individual and shall cooperate with Client and indemnify Client regarding any investigation or response to a security breach,  including any claims, notifications or protection of Client's employees related therewith.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the commitment to adhere to the Privacy Policy in the use of User Data, EFS now has the contractual right to use the data in ways that violate privacy laws. The deletion of the security program requirements removes the legal obligation to protect user data, creating a vulnerability to data breaches and potential legal liability under data protection laws like GDPR or CCPA, depending on the location of the users.
perturbation.contradicted_law: GDPR (General Data Protection Regulation), CCPA (California Consumer Privacy Act)

perturbation.original_text: In addition, Sections 6.1 through 6.10 shall survive any termination of this Agreement until all  amounts due in connection with activities during the Term are paid and all reports provided.
perturbation.changed_text: In addition, Sections 7.5, 8, 9, 10.4, 10.5, 10.6, 11.4, and 12 through 14 shall survive any expiration or  termination of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the survival clause for sections 6.1 through 6.10 after termination means that EFS is no longer contractually obligated to provide royalty payments, reports or maintain accounting records after the contract ends. This omission creates a legal contradiction because it allows EFS to potentially avoid paying royalties owed for sales made during the Term, which violates standard contract law principles requiring payment for services rendered or goods sold during the contract period.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Standard Contract Law Principles Regarding Payment for Services/Goods Rendered
